text: After only two days in this hotel I reached a state of peace and tranquility rarely found in large hotels. The atmosphere was calm, quiet, stylish and restful; the Ayurvedic massage was a wonderful experience, the gym was always quiet, the rooftop pool was beautiful, and the view from my balcony stunning. The only thing that lets this hotel down is the surly staff; I had to work hard not to get annoyed with their unwillingness to serve drinks in the main restaurant and roof bar, and to communicate pleasantly at reception,

This hotel definitely made my stay in Algarve perfect from A to Z. The staff at the reception are so helpful and welcoming (just like the portuguese people in general). We stayed here for a week in a very big one bedroom apartment. The quality of the apartment was outstanding, the kitchen is fully equipped with the newest appliances, the bathroom is very clean, and there is A/C in all the rooms. The apartment was fully cleaned on a daily basis, I was surprised that she even took the time to wash the dishes!!! The breakfast and dinner buffet are good, although I recommend that you check out restaurants outside the hotel during your stay in Lagos. All the hotel is very clean and the most rooms have views on the pools or the seaside. Free wifi and indoor/outdoor parking in the hotel. The wifi wasn't very strong in our apt but it didn't bother us much. The hotel isn't in the centre of Lagos, so I definitely recommend that you rent a car when visiting the Algarve, especially if you wanna visit different beaches and cities, it is the most practical way to move around. I definitely recommend this hotel for any couples or families visiting Lagos.

Just finishing a fantastic week at The Tivoli Hotel.  All I can say is that is was first class all round, from the room, to the facilities, food and service.Hoping we can book again next year - but for anyone thinking of staying would highly recommend.Thanks Tivoli Hotel and to all the staff that work so hard to make it a fantastic stay.

The junior suite premium with the jacuzzi is the best room in the hotel and we loved staying there. The check in process was great and we were allowed an early check in which was amazing. Wish the sky bar was open but sadly it wasn’t. Would love to come back again.

I was immediately struck by the cleanliness of the Hotel and subsequently discovered this efficiency continued throughout every aspect of the premises. More adroit and proficient than home comforts, but superb value close to the promenade, bars, restaurants and shopping. Friendly service from all staff, the inclusive breakfast was adequate with hot and cold variations, the only reason not to offer 5 stars were the two intrusive signs in English on the breakfast table, warning guests not to take food out of the dining room or they would be charged ! On reflection, does this perhaps say more about the Brits than the Hotel ?

5 out of 5. It is one of the best places we have traveled to in the past 10  years. Everything was perfect. Hotel very clean, stuff was friendly, good variety of food. Entertainment was at its best. Very good kids activities and the evening shows were fantastic. Highly recommended.

Very good for families with children. The entertainment for children aged 4 and over is quite good. It allows children to stay entertained and parents to rest for most of the day.The food is also suitable for children and adults.

Location five stars! Great stay! Careful service, huge room and comfortable. Nice pool. Breakfast with everything you need. Repeat! The best Vila Galé of many I have been to.  Great choice for those travelling with children.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: Awesome little hotel with an attentive and helpful staff. From check-in to check-out, the staff provided quick service in English. The rooms are beautiful and definitely deserving of 5 stars.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Stayed at this hotel 12th Dec. 2015   .The older rooms which are the majority are very tired looking and old fashioned with the typical old farmhouse style furnishings.   I believe the newer upgraded rooms are much better but they are fewer in number.   The WI Fi connection is  poor and the television package is pathetic with only  3 news channels in English and the poorest reception I have ever encountered in any hotel. There is no tea / coffee making facilities in the older rooms unless you specifically request which seems strange for an hotel.  Breakfast very acceptable and fine dining average to good although a little on the expensive side for what you get for example €13.50 for a tiny portion of prawn cocktail   did not seem to be particularly good value . The staff are generally well mannered and friendly. The ground level entry is nicely presented and the newly refurbished bar area is welcoming .The golf package probably is one of the attractions of this hotel but I have to be honest in my assessment and categorically state that this is no longer a five star accommodation

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Châteaux
text: This is a very nice, boutique hotel with amazing views of the Douro Valley.  Staff was pleasant and helpful.  Lovely breakfast buffet and we enjoyed our one dinner onsite.  One suggestion would be to have a staff member onsite in the morning to provide coffee/tea to guests looking for such ahead of the 8:30 breakfast start - especially since the remote location does not allow for any other options.

Excellent hotel, great location and fab breakfast.Bed was super comfortable, shower lovely, the room was very stylishStaff were knowledgeable and very friendlyBreakfast was very good, serviced to 10:30

Had a lovely stay mid September 2019. Positives Quality hotel, rooms,staff,pools, lifts, and food all fantastic. No sun bed rush but I think it would be a different story in the summer season.Negatives: a bit to close to the main strip. Standard double overlooking large busy Irish bar. We were facing the front of hotel. But when the patio is closed at night you can't hear anything. Standard whiskey on AI is a flavoured one.It was a lovely quality hotel and I would go back.

Pleasant place with very nice staff, great for kids and very reasonably priced. Service is efficient and you’ll be well looked after here. Recommend sitting outdoors as heat can be stifling inside the arches in the evening

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: 3 adults in room. Did not realize was a timeshare otherwise would have not booked. Asked for room in hotel with 2 doubles so we could sleep comfortably and refused. All they offered was a “topper” for uncomfortable thin pull out couch mattress.

You'll never find a better place to stay. The hotel is spotless. Breakfast is not just continental.From day one the staff was welcoming and helpful.When we asked what to see and how to get there, they invited mebehind the desk and pulled up things on the computer.The hotel is located on a lovely square that let's the breeze in.Outdoor and indoor seating and several places to eat within steps of the hotel.Staff recommended getting a metro pass that gives you access to the metro, busses and trolley to get around. It was great!Special thanks to Ahlana, Catarina and Mafalda, for your wonderful suggestions,  hospitality and the Breakfast box on our departure.Lenna & Ken

We spent two wonderful days in Porto and the Casas do Porto apartment was ideal. The location was perfect and we could not have asked for a better accommodation. The breakfast was lovely and plentiful, and having fresh bread delivered each morning was a treat. The apartment is fully stocked so it would be easy to spend many days there and be able to host others. The hosts were amazing and so responsive. We would definitely stay there again if our travels take us back to Porto!

Lovely holiday! We stayed in one of the apartments on the bottom floor. This was so handy as there were steps leading up to the pool from the balcony. This meant we could leave the patio doors open and nip in and out for shade breaks! The apartment was very spacious with everything you need to be self catering if you wanted. The cleaners came in every day to change your bedding. The air con was a god send! There was also free wifi everywhere in the hotel with brilliant signal.The pool area was nice. Everyday we could get sun beds and it was very quiet. We tried breakfast around the hotel in the small cafes. We didn't really rate them and ended making our own in the morning. We had dinner in the hotel. It was lovely and not overly priced! The old town was about a 15 minute walk, which was down hill on the way but a big hill on the way up, however we did walk there and back as it wasn't too bad. All in all a lovely holiday. We would definitely recommend going back.

situated in a mostly residential area so it's very quiet, no bars/loud music nearby - ideal if you like peace & quiet - we stayed in room 74 as i heard on previous reviews that it had a private roof terrace - in hindsight we wish we had not chosen this room as it's always nice on holidays to have a balcony so that you can just step outside to get some fresh air & sit out in the evenings - i had presumed the entrance to the private roof terrace would have been IN our room but it wasn't, we had to go outside our room into the public hallway & up 2 flights of stairs to the room - the 3 mornings we were there we were laying out in the sun when the cleaner barged in on top of us & opened out the door, putting a stopper against it to hold it open, this made us feel uncomfortable as any of the people staying there could have came up there - we were also made to feel as though we had to leave the door open as the cleaner made a point of opening it - we were told however at reception during the week that the door should be kept closed? very confusing .... the pool area was very quiet, always able to get a sun lounger/umbrella etc. - however we found it TOO quiet - you could hear a pin drop - would be nice to have a pit of background music however low volume. the room was cleaned 3 times while we stayed but our bed sheets weren't changed even once while we were there ..... it it about a 4 minute walk to the nearest bar/restaurant - merlin's bar is great for drinks on the way down to the town or on the way home - eddy's bar next to it does very reasonable & tasty food, some of the nicest pizzas we ever had - it is a downhill walk to the old town so a trudge uphill on the way back up - ladies don't wear heels going out in the night time - i did the first night & it was a real struggle, i nearly fell so many times, all the footpaths, side streets etc. around the town are cobbled & the cobbles are very shiny & slippery .... the beach here is gorgeous - loads of watersports  .... the marina is a sight to behold, really worth the walk over to it - about 15/20 mins walk, the irish bar at the marina is great for food & lots of room there, loads for kids to do over at the marina - arcade games, little quad bikes, karting etc. & it's also the take off point for a lot of boat tours & trips, we were there for one night for sunset & it was beautiful - if you like the nightlife in the old town, i wouldn't suggest taking a trip to the old town, it's everything i've grown to hate about resorts over the last few years, groups of guys going around drunk in the middle of the day ogling women & intimidating people, very loutish & just didn't feel safe there (this was still early evening time), we ate had a drink & hightailed it back to the told town very quickly! definitely not suitable for families or couples wanting a relaxing holiday ..... all in all, i would recommend staying in the old town & these apartments would be ideal for a couple wanting a relaxing holiday

I have to echo other reviews. The place is nicely situated in albufiera, clean and friendly.  What more can you ask for?The one negative is or should I say are the beds. As others have said the beds are hard. I am used to a firm mattress but these were HARD.If the mattress situation were resolved the place would be close on perfect for the money.

We stayed in one of the suites in Oct 2015.  The hotel is a busy spot, there is a hostel and some rooms so it attracts all kinds of people. The restaurants there are very good - we ate there on our last night and it was one of the best meals of the week.The location is excellent - but you have to be prepared for the hills - we always walked into the city - one street away is a great street for local restaurants and FADO singers etc.. and we would get a taxi back - about €5 from the Rossio.We had a suite - which is really just a hotel room, on the top floor - where we could see the Castello de St Jorge over on the other hill. The sunsets were spectacular.Our room was fully airconditioned, which we were very grateful for as it was a particularly humid week.Everything in the building is old, all the furniture etc.. so its a real eclectic mix of things. I liked it, but it might not be to everyone's taste.Also, its an old building, so the lift is only big enough for two people as is a bit on the rickety side.Finally, our rate included breakfast, which was served in the roof restaurant in the building next door.It was served until 11am - and it was perfect, fresh scrambled eggs, plenty of cereal, breads, coffee, juices etc.I would stay here again. The location is the best.

Stayed here for four nights to attend a conference at the Catholic University which was just across the road. The room was large with two double beds, a good size flat screen television with plenty of channels in English, ironing board and iron, coffee and team making facilities but no milk, a mini fridge, hairdryer etc. The room also had a balcony. The bathroom was large with a shower over a bath, hairdryer and the usual assortment of individual shampoos etc.The major difficulty I had with the room was the light in the closet which would not go off and I eventually found the switch on the light itself to do this -initially I just thought it would go off when closed the sliding doors. This was a problem for others.The hotel had a couple of shops a bar with a tapas menu and a nice lounge there was also a restaurant which also doubled up for eating breakfast. Breakfast had a wide range of options and you can purchase different breakfast packages. The hotel also has a two tier hi-fi packages whilst the high package is god enough for most things it created a problem when I Skyped.This is not a small hotel and is used by bus tour companies and for airline staff as it is close to the airport. To get a taxi down to the old town - too far to walk - was 6.50Euros and to the river front 8.50 Euros. There is a metro station 10 mins away.Overall the Marriott proved a very convenient and pleasant place to stay.

Loved the enjoyment of the outdoor pool, gardens, outdoor setting to dine, the pleasant service for drinks and snacks, the range of foods at the breakfast buffet. Souveneir shop sold stamps and nice mementos of Portugal.

If you haven't got a hire car,this is not for you - near to airport rather than the city.If you paying rack rate,dittoA 4 star at 5 star pricesRooms becoming jaded,cupboards no longer fit,plugs worn out etc etcStay in the Sheraton

The Casa Mitchell Apartments are in an excellent location.  I think the following is essential information (bearing in mind we were in a studio apartment).Kitchen – Studio is smaller and hence the supplies are smaller.  The frying pan we had was so small it would only do one egg at a time.  We asked at reception if we could have a bigger one and was very impressed to have a brand new one shortly after.  I think this shows how flexible they are.  Our kitchen was a good size (see the picture).Bedroom – Personally I thought the bedroom was a good size (for a studio, and it was separate to the kitchen area).  My husband was happy too but he did complain that the beds were far too hard.  I think that’s quite normal abroad though (I am sure he complains about this in most places we have stayed).Bathroom – Hot water whenever we had showers, good shower as well.Balcony – the studio balcony is tiny – the 1 bedroom balconies looked bigger… We didn’t have any sun (or very little) on the balcony and to be honest that suited me, but its probs not for everyone.Pool – Looks small in the pics, is small in reality however actually thought this was better than other larger pools for 2 reasons.No kids were there (no splashing).  Often there was no one in the pool, or just me.  There was no booking of sunbeds (I was the first person at the pool every day at around 9am which is a welcome change from having to get a sun bed at 6am in many resorts)!The pool was warm (as it has less water to heat up)!Husband tells me I must mention the lack of sun bed mats (I think he must have a bad back as he complained about the hard beds and lack of sun bed mats).  He did ask at the hotel about this and apparently tourists kept stubbing cigarettes out on the mats so they got rid of them!Supermarket – The hotel is on 2 sides of the road.  If you’re in the hotel with the pool (opposite reception), when you come out of the hotel, turn LEFT.  Top of the road there is a mini market (overpriced in my opinion at the top which is 10 seconds walk for essentials) turn LEFT.  Follow the road down and turn RIGHT.  This is Sir Cliff Richards Road (something similar) and after a few mins you will find a large supermarket that sells everything you will need.  We only went to this one (and the fresh bread and cakes were gorgeous).  This is about 7 mins walk.Old Town = If you are in the side of the hotel with the pool, turn RIGHT.  At the end of the road turn right again.  Follow the road down (passing a green statue on your left). Cross over the road and follow the road down. there are some steps in front of you (talking you into the old town) or keep going and turn LEFT when you can SEE a sign for Royal Orchid Thai Restaurant (this takes you into the old town as well).  About 10 mins walk from the hotel.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Old world charm...this was our first trip abroad post pandemic and we were not disappointed. The views from the hotel are simply out of this world. It’s also worth knowing that the hotel is in town, walking distance (or a very short taxi ride away) from restaurants, shops, the harbour and the old town.The swimming pool (normal and salted water) are great - children tend to hog the normal pool (this was half term after all) but the other one is usually free for adult swimmers or just a dip. There seems to be a bit of a race in the morning to reserve the chairs by the pool or the sea! But there is always one free somewhere if you’re not an early riser.The jewel crown of the hotel is the seafront which is accessed by steep steps (or a lift) with 2 diving boards and a large pool which gets filled with seawater through the waves. It’s a beautiful place.Also worth mentioning are the quiet lush gardens.The food is gorgeous whether that’s breakfast (huge choices with lots of healthy options), lunch by the pool and dinner upstairs in the terrace.  I enjoyed the fact that people dress up properly for dinner.We didn’t get to try  Villa Cipriani which was fully booked every night of our stay - so make sure to book it as soon as you book your stay!The staff is very friendly and attentive. Service was a bit slow sometimes, but the hotel had recently reopened after the pandemic, and was full. So I will make allowance for that. They were aware of the issue and regularly apologised.Our rooms were lovely, with sea views. The toiletries are from Porto Claus - smelling wonderful.The concierge has plenty of good recommendations for tours by boat or jeep.The old black and white photos decorating the wall are testament to the history of the hotel (also visited by Churchill) and we did get a real sense of this old world charm.Not a cheap option, but certainly a luxuriously decadent option!

Have stayed at the Royal Savoy on two occasions now and both stays were completely satisfactory. The RS has a number of room options varying in size as well as self-catering suites.As befitting a Savoy branded hotel on arrival your bags disappear to be delivered to your room by the time you have checked in. The reception staff are very efficient ensuring check-in takes no longer than necessary and provide you with plenty of information regarding activities in and around the hotel.The rooms themselves are fairly 'traditional' in terms of décor but are spotlessly maintained and all have excellent views of the pool area and the sea beyond. The pool area is very large and has a wide range of options for seating and sunbeds etc. The pool bar is open from 10 or so and provides an excellent range of drinks and snacks - although these are expensive in relation to surrounding bars and restaurants. A terrace restaurant and an indoor formal restaurant completes the available dining options. There is also a lounge/cocktail bar indoors which is small but provides a good array of cocktails, wines etc.Most evenings have a 'theme' in dining terms and are priced from about 30 euros upwards per person.Overall the RS has an 'old style' luxury fell to it and certainly won't disappoint and traveller who stays there.

We stayed on an Interval International exchange and we could not have been more pleased.  Truly an amazing and wonderful experience!!!  We traded a 2 bedroom unit, so we received a two bedroom unit at the Royal Savoy.  I don't know if it was because our flight didn't get us there until 1 AM for check-in but they gave us one of their two, two bedroom Presidential Suites (room 1418).  Really a wonderful Suite with all the amenities and daily maid service too.  The view is amazing, 270 degrees, overlooking the pool and directly out over the ocean.  It could not be more beautiful!!!  The staff is exceptional and very knowledgeable about Funchal and will go out of their way to make your stay just perfect.  They welcome the opportunity to help you select a restaurant then call to make your reservation.  We told them we were celebrating an Anniversary and they sent us a bottle of wine, two glasses and flowers.  The location is also within walking distance to downtown so that saves a lot of time and taxi fares!  If you go to Funchal then we HIGHLY recommend you stay at the Royal Savoy!  Say Hi to Jose at the pool bar when you see him!

Spent a wonderful 10 days here we were upgraded to a better room on arrival which was wonderful  Staff were excellent all spoke English and nothing was too much trouble. It was  my birthday whilst I was there  and they brought champagne  and a birthday cake too our room from the management. Would recommend anyone to go will definitely  return . excellent  location.

Stayed here in February - first time we have been here at this time of year.  Temperature was in low low 60s or 18 /19 degrees.   Lots warmer than the UK but did not feel warm enough to swim outside but we did sunbathe or some days and got quite a tan on some days.  It was hot enough to sit out and eat at lunchtime but had to eat inside in the evenings.  Hotel was still as lovely as ever.  Service very good.  The rooms are well specced with everything you could need in the kitchen.  The cleaners come in every day and fold your nightear into fancy shapes and leave little chocolates on the pillows.  Love the decor, especially all the Tribal art collection and the view from the room.  The only downside was the lack of wi-fi, you have to pay to be wired in.There is still lots to do at this time of year.  One day we hired a taxi to Porto Monix.  We have been here for the swimming in the summer but it was fantastic to see it in the winter.  The waves were enormous and the sea looked like a boiling cauldron - see our photos but on shore there was no wind and you could sit on the edge of the sea with a coffee taking in the sun but next to a raging sea.  Amazing.It was lovely to get some sunshine at this time of year - would recommend a winter visit.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: the hotel is very good but need a lot of renovations. better close one year and begin in a fresh decor.if they continue like that they will lose a lot of clients in some other top rated hotels that opened earlier this year.. with renovations they will become again the best of Madeira.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: My wife and I went here to celebrate our 20 years together. Absolutely fantastic. We had one of the set menus of 8 courses - we had 11 in all! We chose to pay a little extra to have tome different wines that matched the course - superb wine cellar. ALL the staff were so attentive, chatty, friendly and knowledgable - we spent over 4 hours there but it was sooooooo with it. Thank you Reids Palace for such a great treat.

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: Very nice property in Lagos, facing the most iconic beaches of the region, reachable with very pleasant walks.The room was well maintained with an outdoor patio, an indoor sitting area, two TVs, wired broadcasting, plenty of sockets and usb ports. In the fridge available water and wine (the water is recharged when finished), there is also a coffee machine with some pods available and the kettle.The breakfast is very nice as well as plentiful.Next door is a snack bar, which can be used for lunch and dinner, and a small market.Towels are available for swimming pools open until 8 p.m.The road to the city center is very feasible on the way out, for the return we always opted for uber that works very well (with 4 € you returned).There is a parking lot where we have always found a place, vice versa you can leave the car in the back street, from which there is another gate to access the bb.They were 4 very nice days, it was worth the price paid.

Excellent location, just 10 minutes walk from down town. Nice pool section outdoors and inside. Classic setting, excellent service and very helpful & professional staff. Breakfast provided wide selection and also authentic fruits etc. Very peacefull at least before Christmas.

Amazing ancient house with antique moldings and doors in the city centre. Very cozy apartment with three french balconies. Very comfortable bed. Welcome drink (bottle of red vine) and fruits. free coffe capsules. Friendly staff.

Very nice hotel beautiful outlook over the bay excellent location,friendly helpful staff. Very good selection of food at breakfast and evening meal,wish the plates had been in a warmer as the food was never very hot,but that would be the only negative comment I could make .

Second visit to this hotel. A very well managed hotel with a very good atmosphere.We had a junior suite which is in need of a major upgrade as they are looking very tired and we experienced a number of maintenance issues which should not happen with this standard of hotel.Would go back if rooms upgraded

Situated just outside Armacao de Pera with a free bus service into and back to the hotel this Hotel is in a quiet location near to the church of Senhora da Rocha,It has indoor and outdoor pools a gym and health suite,extensive gardens,although quiet in its location there is a kiddies club and also excellent evening entertainment if required.There are plenty of good restaurants within easy walking and the town of Armacao de Pera is about a 20 mins walk but a taxi back would be preferable{ uphill @ about 5 euros well worth it }The hotel is very clean and well maintained, and all the staff are very helpful and will tend to all your needs with a smile

This was the greatest hotel to ever be a hotel. The location is perfect and is right next to the strip and the beach. The bar is orgasmic. My mate had a few tugs in the bathroom. Recommend for any lads holiday. The food is horror though but it doesn't really matter when the drinks at the bar are cold.

First the good...nice pool, friendly staff, great views...now the bad....1) they offer NO PARKING. You have to find parking on the street. Plus there is no parking space to check in. I had to park in a handicap spot and for the 10 minutes I was checking in, I got yelled at for this. 2) We were 3 adults that rented a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite...but they would only give us 1 key. I have stayed at hundreds of hotels worldwide and this was the first time I was denied a 2nd key. It made it difficult to coordinate people coming and going. 3) Our 2nd bedroom did not have an AC vent and it was stifling at night. They did offer to move us and give us a 2nd key on the last day of our stay but too little too late. 4) This is a family resort. 90% of the people there had kids 16 and under. So if you are an adult looking to sit by the pool with a quiet cocktail, this is NOT the place. 5) One of our bath towels had a hole in it...really? 6) Pool area needs landscaping. Where we sat poolside was on dirt and when you are wet on dirt, it makes mud. 7) Only dinner option was a buffet. With COVID and kids sticking their fingers everywhere, buffets are off limits...so we went to neighboring hotels and gave them our dinner business...and finally 8) their letterhead said it is a Beach and Golf resort...did not see a golf course anywhere and the beach is a public beach next door that you have to walk down quite a ways to get to and being a hotel guest gets you nothing. So if you you are an adult with a car who dislikes buffets, likes your towels with no holes, likes AC... then stay away from this place.

Firstly and most importantly the staff are amazing, helpful, friendly and knowledgeable so no issues there. The buffet breakfast is excellent with more than enough to keep you going. Evening menu was excellent and reasonably priced (either a la carte or buffet).The rooms are clean and nicely laid out (bathroom was very good) and with the balcony overlooking the beach the views were fantastic. There is also wifi included in the room costs.The down side, IMHO, considering this is a 5 star hotel, is the amount of additional services that guests need to pay for. Simple things like tea and coffee in the room (although two small bottles of water were given each day complimentary), e10 for an hour on the pool table, e11 for the use of the internal pool and Jacuzzi to name but a few.However this did not distract from out enjoyment of what is otherwise an excellent hotel.

Visited here a couple of weeks ago with 4 other friends, we wanted a relaxing but fun girls holiday without cheap tack and that's exactly what we got! A beautiful hotel throughout from rooms to pool to location. The hotel is a 5/10 minute walk to the marina which has several restaurants and bars and is a 5 minute taxi ride from Aquashow which is a great water park! Staff were exceptionally helpful and attentive and the food was amazing! We spent a good amount each whilst we were there but it was definitely worth it. Would return to this hotel in the future for sure!

Stayed here May 2016 fab hotel, on arrival greeted by staff for help with luggage and quick check in.  (although it was evening time so not rush hour).  The hotel is really lovely and the pool area is huge with plenty of beds and umbrellas and loads of beach towels for you.  If you are lying on the grassy area of pool you have a sea view which I liked.  (only downside was noise of music and bellowing voices coming from beach loud speaker-drove me mad) but this was not the fault of hotel.  The rooms and bathrooms were really big, I had a side sea view room.  The breakfast was great lots on offer.Just a couple of minor things for such a star rated hotel - no pool service and not many pool staff around to help.  I like hotels that have plenty of staff around pool who take drink/coffee orders without you having to move.A tad slow at breakfast time to allocate tables and I was there in May so god knows how busy it will get in peak season.Staff were slow to come to your table to ask about tea/coffee our breakfast was gone each morning before we got someones attention to bring coffee.We had to wait and look around for ages before someone came and took our order.The rooms were clean but whilst looking for something under the bed, there was alot of dust.The spa is fab but way way too expensive you have to pay 11euros to use pool and sauna and steam room etc.   If you get a spa treatment use of these are free.  I paid 50euros for half hour treatment (which was really 20mins)  but that was my fault as I misread the price list, so watch for prices.  The treatments are very expensive compared to other hotels in the area.I would return again for sure but wouldnt avail of the expensive unjustified spa treatments.Also it is a good 10min walk to marina where all the restaurants and bars are.

This hotel is in a great central location, everythingâ€™s nearby. The staff are very helpful/friendly. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and will be returning without a doubt. Go try it for yourself!!!

The staff is forced to be friendly.We stayed in a nice room, close to the bathroom where ... they were throwing out in the middle of the night.The breakfast wasn't enough. We had only sweet choices (if we had the chance to grab anything left).Few ppl talked to us even if we made the effort to have a drink at the bar.We poorly seized the wifi.We experienced best and warmer wlecome. Was it due to the fact to be welcomed by non-local ppl or was this just a trend?

This amazing little B&B in the hills above Loule was the setting for my first wedding anniversary having been Wed in the Algarve the previous year. Having stayed at some of the big resorts on the Algarve coast, Casa Da Tita is by far the best place I have stayed in my 15+ years of visiting the Algarve. From the lovely breakfasts, scenic pool area and the amazing family that run it, Casa Da Tita is definitely a must when staying in the Algarve.

Rooms are adequate but not cleaned very well. Wellness centre closed for week I was here. Was not advised in advance. Food is terrible ! Canteen style school dinners with little imagination. Apart from three small (ish) sandy beaches little to do. Local town 10 minutes away by car and uninspiring. Overall just very average.

We stayed here for 5 nights during our stay in Porto. We were given one of the new mini apartments, which has a little kitchenette. The room was brand new, which sadly also meant that the kitchenette was not functional, no water kettle, no tea/coffee provided, when we asked we were told several stories, depending on who we asked, it was either the items had not yet arrived or that they decided not to provide these amenities.The location and the view made up for these shortcoming. It's a 10 minute walk to Ribeira, the hustle and bustle riverfront cafes and restaurant with another 10-15 minutes walk to the city centre.

Our third time at Hotel Albergaria Dias. As always the same high quality: competent and friendly employees; room cleaning is excellent; every wish is fulfilled; and last but not least: their amazing breakfast!!!!This was our third stay at Hotel Albergaria Dias. The quality was fantastic as always: the staff are knowledgeable and friendly and always have good advice; room cleaning is excellent; every wish can be fulfilled (within reason, of course); and finally: a breakfast of exceptional quality!!!

Excellent service at Reception, getting taxis quickly, room service- ac fault dealt with very promptly, good food at bar and lovely design and room layouts.Roof terrace felt sparse- maybe some luxurious planting and colour to contrast the black theme? Breakfast food and staff service -with a smile- was a great start to my days

We booked three rooms for three nights in this hotel, primarily for the views. Despite asking for rooms with a view, we were all given rooms at the 4th floor. All rooms had a balcony that had a wall about 5 feet tall pretty much blocking all the view. It was lime a joke! We asked for a change but no interest in helping out. The staff was not helpful in general. We could have picked close by Pestana or similar if we had known. Once the primary reason you book is not fulfilled, the rest is hard to judge so no comments on cleanliness, etc. not worth staying unless you get a room on 2nd or 3rd floor.

hotel_name: Porto PalÃ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
text: This is the second time I stay in this hotel and the experience was once again, an excellent one.It is conveniently located and close to the main transportation hubs and motorways.The staff are very friendly, attentive, always ready to help and nothing is too much trouble.The hotel is very well presented, looking very fresh and an amazing roof top bar with a lovely view over the city.Great breakfast buffet where youâ€™re spoiled for choice, including champagne. Its actually champagne, not cheap cava or Prosecco!Love the 24hr bar concept, where you can go for a quiet drink after a night out.Rooms always spotless, nicely decorated and lovely touch with the chocolates that are offered with the turndown service.In all, I loved staying here and definitely will be back again.

I can only recommend the house. Super friendly and helpful staff. Large and clean bedroom and bathroom. Nice breakfast buffet. The outdoor area is also very well maintained.The restaurant in the house is good.The air conditioning could be a bit quieter and the loungers are not very comfortable.

Nice location overlooking a marina. Deluxe rooms have this view but the cheaper rooms are also very nice.  Fabulous restaurant at reasonable prices.  Sunday brunch is very special.  Staff are great.  Nice spa. We wanted to relax and we did.   Good beds and quiet rooms.   We will be going back.

The hotel was in a quiet location. Having a garden view room was extremely pleasant. Continental breakfast was more than adequate. Honesty bar works well.The bed was comfortable. The layout of the room did not suit my taste as the bathroom area lacked privacy. Although I understand that all rooms are not the same.

Having just returned from a quick week away I must stress how amazing this hotel is. Incredible staff delightful hotel with incredible views. Amazing restaurants.centrally located for every thing that Madeira supplies. If you have not been to the island before make sure it’s the Cliff Bay hotel you book.

Beautiful hotel. Great location. Splendid views. Very modern and chic design. A bit far from central lisbon. The only let down is the size of the rooms. And only allowed 2 coffees or teas per day in your room as courtesy. Ambiance is hotel is good. Staff are very helpful. The spa is awesome.

We spent one night in this hotel on the last night in Lisbon, it's over the other side of the city, quicker to airport. Very good front desk staff. Room was very clean, everything you'd need, good tv. Didn't have breakfast so can't say. It's very near a huge shopping centre with a fantastic food hall.

Nice modern hotel with an amazing lobby and bar. The receptionist stroke me with her extremely warm welcoming and her simplicity. She was so helpful and gave us good advice (Too bad i forgot her name).Rooms are simple yet modern with all necessary amenities. We had a view over the pool which was ok. The weather on that day didn't help us a lot.It is a nice 10-12 min walk to the old city. Would definitely recommend this stay.

I stayed at the Hotel Principe Lisboa on two different occasions in July, 2014. I was quite satisfied with the hotel, with three minor caveats,  two of which are outside the control of the hotel.The room was a good size, with a large TV and a small desk. The bathroom was excellent – not cramped at all with a shower – good water pressure and no problem with hot water.  Breakfast was good. In addition to the usual cheese and meat slices and pastries (including excellent pasteis de nata if you get there early enough) they had a very good and varied fruit bowl.  The people who worked in the breakfast room kept the food topped up, and bussed the tables immediately. Never had a problem getting a table or finding food trays empty. There was a small refrigerator in both rooms I had, which did not double as a mini-bar. I prefer it that way.Both rooms I was in had a balcony with a table and two comfortable chairs. There's no view to speak of but it's great to sit outside in the relative cool of the evening and have a glass of wine, and a snack on the balcony. You can buy snacks at El Cortes Ingles around the corner and keep them in the fridge. I'm not sure all rooms have balconies, so ask.There is a tiny bar on the ground floor that I never really saw anybody use.The free wi-fi worked great.The front desk staff were polite and helpful, and fully fluent in English.Caveat 1:  The room safe is the old fashioned kind where you need to get the lock and key from the front desk (no charge, but a 20 Euro deposit). I hate these safes. The last thing I want is to be responsible for not losing the safe key when I am out.Caveat 2: There is no decent place to eat near the hotel. There are a couple of early-closing not-very-impressive cafes but other than that, not much.Caveat 3: On paper the location looks excellent, and for the most part it is. It is at the end of the red metro line which means you can get to and from the airport and the Oriente train station without a metro transfer, and it is also on the blue line which gets you right downtown, and to the Rossio and St. Apolonia train stations, in a couple of stops. The picture on the website suggests that the metro entrance is right across the street, which it is. However that entrance is to the red line, and there are no lifts or elevators up the considerable distance to the street. The elevators and lifts are at the very other end of the station, on the blue line/El Cortes Ingles side. The sidewalks in all of Lisbon are uneven, and occasionally broken, cobblestone. In short, they are rubbish to walk on (very attractive though). Also there is almost no such thing as level ground in Lisbon outside the downtown tourist areas. So the above ground walk from the  blue line/El Cortes Ingles side is not easy for people with walking difficulties (me). For the fully ambulatory it should be no problem.Overall, good hotel, good value, location fine if you're not mobility impaired. I probably wouldn't stay there again because of my mobility issues, but if the city ever put escalators on the red line side, I'd stay there again, no problem. Recommended.

I stopped here for 4 nights.  The hotel is easy to find and is within easy reach from Marques de Pombal metro station using the red & yellow lines from the airport.The hotel is up two flights of stairs, there’s an elevator/ lift.  I would recommend checking google maps before arriving as the hotel is part of a commercial building and can be easily missed (I used the clothes shop next to the hotel entrance as a point of reference)My room adequate size with on suite bathroom, two single beds, tv and air con.  Towels were changed every day and bedding every other day.  I had no issues with the WIFI although I was near to reception where I assume the hub was situated.The continental breakfast consisted of cereals, tea, coffee juice and bread rolls.  Ham and cheese were on the table with preserves and jam.From the hotel is a 20 minute walk to the main city centre with restaurants and shops.The owners were very friendly and were always around the reception area of the hotel to let you.I would definitely stop here again.

Just arrived back after a Five Night â€œWinter all-inclusiveâ€ stay at this hotel.With this being such a large hotel and reading the reviews only a few days before we arrived I did wonder how the service would be affected.I can honestly say we had the best time, so close to the beach, high levels of security with access cards needed to get in and around areas .No fighting for sun-beds, choice of two pools, one close to a bar.We sampled the Grill and the Mexican as part of the speciality restaurants. The food and service was fantastic.Shout out to Gabrielle, who served us most days in the Ocean Bar.Cleanliness of the rooms was also fantastic, linen changed ones and towels changed every day.Will definitely revisit for a summer all-inclusive where there will be a wider choice of restaurants to dine in.It just goes to show that reviews arenâ€™t always right. Yes itâ€™s great as a guide however always go and make up your own mind.

It is some years since we last visited, and we were as pleased with these appartments as we had been before. The location is excellent, the appartments are enormous and those on first and second floor have very large south facing balconies with views of the sea. They are well furnished in traditional style and equipped although some items are a little dated. The pool area continues to be well maintained, quiet and attractive. The restaurants and cafes in the immediate area have improved since our last visit - Earth next door is well worth a visit for coffee or breakfast. The appartments remain excellent value.

It was well worth the long drive along a forest road (Casa Pinha is well signposted if your satnav plays tricks on you like ours did).  The view over Figuera da Foz is fantastic, rooms spotlessly clean and comfortable (mattress a little too firm for me, though) with free wi-fi, small TV and H&C air conditioning.  En-suite shower rooms have individual water heaters. The owner was welcoming and spoke a few words of English. The buffet breakfast was decent, with tea or coffee served at the table.  The restaurant and pool are open to the public.This is really a perfect place to stay in summer, with the Atlantic breeze cooling the sun terrace around the pool, which was just warm enough to swim in on a sunny early October day but in the winter I would imagine the location could be chilly and bleak.

Beautiful hotel in the height of Carvoeiro, ideal to spend a few nights, literally next to the beach!The room was confortable and wide.Excellent service, with breakfast on the terrace of the room looking at the sea! Highly recommended! We will return for sure!

Not being the first time at this inn, I can only say that the care and services continue to be excellent.Reinforce that the friendliness and professionalism of the employees is notable.It is worth highlighting the service provided by Ana Catarina Inácio, at check-in she was very available to help us with everything we needed.Breakfast has changed a lot, it has more diversity and quality of products.I highly recommend this guesthouse, they are incredible and we will be back very soon.

Our accommodation was made directly on the hotel's website and we booked a room with a sea view, with a balcony and an extra bed. When we got there, they allocated a room without a balcony, with a view over a roof and super small. The situation was promptly resolved but I had to pay more to change our room. This room has generous areas, but with many details to be taken care of. No air conditioning, clogged sink, broken bathroom tiles, stained carpet, broken safe, door to the balcony in the second room didn't open and the balcony had cobwebs on the railing.In addition to all this, the staff are super friendly, the breakfast is very good and the view is spectacular.We're just sorry that there's no fun around the hotel!!!!I give 3 stars in the review but I recommend staying for rest.....
